page.title: 07Housing in Rawdon
page.content: There is a wide variety of housing in the Rawdon district.A few old halls and mansions,some dating from the first Elizabethan era,are still used as private homes,and there are many old Yorkshire-stone cottages.Those in Little London have been extensively renovated,and this is now a conservation area. Gradual expansion of housing has taken place this century,including small estates of both private and council houses,and developments of sheltered accommodation for the elderly.Most property is privately owned,and a wide range is available, varying in price from about Â£20 000 to over Â£100 000. The present population of Rawdon village is approximately 6 580,and there are no plans for any major developments within the next 10 years.
